title.narrative: Revenue Mobilization Program for Results: VAT Improvement Program (VIP)

description.narrative: The PDO is to improve revenue mobilization and transparency in the VAT administration.

condition.narrative: 2a. The Recipient shall carry out, under terms of reference acceptable to the Association, the following independent taxpayersatisfaction surveys- 2014 survey by no later than June 30, 2015.Status: The GoB has officially announced that the new date forimplementation of the new VAT Law would be July 2017. As a result, the survey to measure taxpayers satisfaction with servicesprovided by VAT Wing and to establish the baseline under the current VAT Law with a covenant (obligation) to be carried out andpublicly disclosed on June 30, 2015 is no longer feasible, and there is an agreement to comply with it by June 30, 2016. NBRwill use the methodology developed by the IFC and will hire a local survey company to carry out an independent survey on taxpayersatisfaction with services provided by the VAT Wing. Draft ToR and questionnaire is expected to be shared with the Bank before thenext mission in October, 2015.
2b. The Recipient shall carry out, under terms of reference acceptable to the Association, the following independent taxpayersatisfaction surveys- 2016 survey by no later than June 30, 2017.

3. By no later than twelve (12) months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall install, and thereafter maintain throughoutthe implementation of the Program, a fixed asset tracking system in the VAT Wing in order to record, track and manage assetsprocured under the Program, including the provision of training to VAT Wing staff in the use of such system. Due date: Sept. 30,2020

4. By no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall form, and thereafter maintain throughout theimplementation of the Program, a 7-member team evaluation committee, under ToR acceptable to the Association, responsible for highvalue (i.e. more than US$ 2 million) IT procurements under the Program. The committee should have at least 1 national expert and 2intl. experts. Due date: October 30, 2014.

5. By no later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall report, and thereafter continue reportingthroughout the implementation of the Program, on key procurement indicators agreed with the Association using the Recipient'sprocurement monitoring systems acceptable to the Association. Due date: March 30, 2015.

6a. By no later than 3 months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall appoint under ToR acceptable to the Association, andthereafter maintain throughout the imp. of the Program, a focal point within ERD responsible for, inter alia, coordinating,monitoring and supporting resolution of any Program monitoring and fund release issues, incl. handling of complaints and financialirregularities. Due date: December 30, 2014.

6bi. By no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall start collecting and compiling into formatsagreed with the Association, and thereafter continue collecting and compiling throughout the implementation of the Program, allProgram fraud and corruption complaints. Due date: December 30, 2014Status: Anti-Corruption Commission is collecting fraud andcorruption complaints and compiling into the format agreed with the Bank.

6bii. By no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall submit, throughout the implementation of theProgram, the aforementioned reports to the Association on a semi-annual basis. Due date: December 30, 2014.Status: First andsecondreports have been received.
7a. By no later than September 30, 2020, the Recipient shall carry out a training on e-waste handling to IT NBR staff. Due date:September 30, 2020

7b. By no later than June 30, 2015, the Recipient shall start, and thereafter maintain throughout the implementation of theProgram, proper record keeping of equipment purchase, reused and auctioned.Status: Given the delay in procurement of ICTequipment, this is not yet due. The asset tracking software procurement has been launched.

8. By June 30, 2015, the Recipient shall set up the NBR's contact center, under terms of reference acceptable to the Association,responsible for, inter alia, properly running a complaint mechanism; such mechanism shall be available on NBR's website.

By no later than June 30, 2016, the Recipient shall establish the Active Registered Baseline referred to in DLR#2.1, the On-lineFiling Baseline referred to in DLR#3.1 and the LTU Baseline referred to in DLR#4.1 of the table set forth in Section IV.A.2 ofSchedule 2 to the Financing Agreement in substance and manner acceptable to the Association.
The Recipient shall carry out, under terms of reference acceptable to the Association, the following independent taxpayersatisfaction surveys- 2018 survey by no later than October 30, 2020.
